title: Conservation of momentum - skaters on pond

content.question: Three skaters are on a frozen pond. Initially, Skater <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is at rest and Skaters <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> are holding hands moving together to the right, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Skater <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> then pushes off of Skater <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and they both continue moving to the right, but Skater <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> moves away from Skater <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Frictional forces between the skaters and the surface of the pond are negligible. Consider the system consisting of all three skaters and the system consisting of only Skaters <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>. Which of the following correctly indicates in which system, if either, there is a change in momentum between Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?

choices.label: The momentum doesn’t change in either system.
The momentum only changes in the system consisting of all three skaters.

The momentum only changes in the system consisting of only Skaters <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>.
The momentum changes in both systems.

content.answer: The momentum doesn’t change in either system.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
